Subjective: Headaches for 2 months, worsening; right-sided predominance, sometimes generalized. Nausea without vomiting; glare sensitivity without flashes. Family history of migraines (father) and possible cluster headaches (grandfather). No smoking, occasional alcohol use, exercises regularly. Concerns: Worried about migraine vs. cluster headaches; seeks advice on management.
Objective: BP 120/80 mmHg; Pulse 50 bpm. Cranial nerves intact; arm/leg strength normal; gait slightly off but otherwise normal.
Assessment: Migraine; ruled out cluster headaches, no signs of serious conditions (e.g., tumors).
Plan: Start pain relief with paracetamol and ibuprofen as needed.
Keep headache diary to identify patterns.
Safety net: Return sooner if symptoms worsen or change.
